Bolsa Alimentacão was a CCT programme from 2001–2003, when it merged with several 
programmes to form the current Bolsa Familia Programme (BFP). Coverage of Bolsa 
Alimentacão in 2003 was 1.5 million persons (about 1% of the population) supported by the 
World Bank and managed by the MoH. Families with pregnant or lactating women and/or 
children less than 7 years of age with a monthly per capita income below US$ 42 received
